title: Best blogging platforms of 2021
html:
What is Blogging?

Blogging is the practice of writing in an informal dairy style way on a website called Blog. Blogging is possible for any category of choice for example technology, fashion, entertainment, news, sports etc.

Here are the best blogging platforms

  1. Wordpress - Wordpress is one of the oldest and most popular blogging platform of today. It was initially released in 27, May, 2003 since then it has been widely adopted by millions of people around the world. It is also an open source software written in PHP which means anyone can use Wordpress software on thier device free of cost. Search Engine Journals claims that Wordpress powers 39.5% of all websites in the world. This claim can make you feel that how much useful and powerful wordpress is being such old platform it still continues to powers a large portion of websites on the internet. It is easily availabe in various hosting providers and that's why it is very easy to get started with the wordpress. Very big companies like Microsoft, Grammarly, NordVPN and more uses Wordpress.

    Pros
    - Large Community
    - Easy installation
    - A huge set of themes
    - Open Source
    - Best third party plugins

    Cons
    - A bit complicated at first
    - In the past it has few security issues
    - A bit slower
  2. Blogger - Blogger is the most oldest and a very famous blogging platform created by Google. It is not open source but free to use for everyone across the world. Blogger is very simple and the most beginner friendly blogging platform. When registering on blogger it gives each blog a subdomain and the flexibility to connect your own personal domain at for of cost. Being backed by Google it is highly secure. It has few official themes and plenty of third party themes as well. It also powers a large portion of blogs on the web.

    Pros
    - Beginner friendly
    - Highly secure and fast
    - Free to use

    Cons
    - Lacks third party plugins
  3. Ghost - It is an non-profit organization which has created an open source blogging platform called Ghost for publishers all around the world. Being open source its code is available on Github and its forever free to use. Ghost powers so many popular websites today. It is one of the modern and new blogging platofrms around. It is written in JavaScript and being a nodejs application it is very fast in its I/O. The Ghost organization claims it to be utpo 1,900% faster than WordPress. It also provides headless functionality though its API which means users can have thier blog data in the form a JSON file and can use that file to render the same blogs on any other frontend of thier choice.

    Pros
    - Fast
    - Modern Interface
    - Headless
    - Open Source
    - Beginner Friendly

    Cons
    - Less third party plugins
    - Setting up is hard no one click installation easily available
    - Less themes

title: 5 myths about software development
html:
Like any other indsutry software development is not left behind in terms of myths floating around freely everywhere. Let's debunk a few in this article.

1. One programming language is better than others

Developers working for a long time in a programming language builds up a kind of attachment to its syntax, tools and other things in its ecosystem. Which is relatable to what we all humans do with other things in our life. For example the first bike, car, house, games, toys etc. Due to this feeling of attachement many developers don't appreciate the fact that every programming language is good and bad in its different uses cases and no one language can perform well in all the areas of software development. In many large scale softwares a single task or service may require multiple programming languages.

2. Writing code is the only thing developers do

Software development is a practice of comming up with a solution in terms of a computer program which can solve the given problem and it can be of industry Healtcare, Coal Mining, Education, Travel, Auto Mobile, Banking etc. To solve the problems with a computer software the developers based on thier roles and experience have to figure out the functioning on the software through designs and divide the problem into several parts so that it can be managed easily and then after the planning and design documents developers have to tackle down each task in a team via writing code. But this not applies to small personal projects.

3. Development should be as fast as possible

In every project dedicating time to planning and gathering the requirements and then trying to fillup all time requiremnts brings up the best result. As mentioned software development is not just about writing code and forcing the developers to skip the necessary steps and just work long hours to release the project as soon as possible will hinder their productivity and thus may results in poor software in the end.

4. Adding a new feature is a super easy

Many times non-technical people thinks that adding a new feature is just a piece of cake but it depends alot on the structure of the codebase as developing a software in a scalable manner is a very difficult task and there's alot of design patterns and practices to follow and many times some developers changes might conflict with the current changes and in worst case senarios can even crash the whole software it was not handeled properly. Adding new features can also break existing featues or cause bugs to the existing features.

5. Testing is not necessary

Many developers specially the beginners or intermediate developers after working on some software projects starts thinking that they can write in a way which is surely not going to have any errors on the runtime and they don't need any tests for the code they have added but companies have software testers because they don't want to risk thier user exeprience over a bug or a crash in their application and that's why experienced software developers understand that testing is crucial part of the sotware development process and specially in the case of dynamic languages testing becomes a must on every part. Because it is true that we all improve from our mistakes or learning from others mistakes and the same applies to software developent erros will happen no matter how much experience you have every error will end up teaching you something throught the software developemnt journey.

title: How to become a Game Developer?
html:
The person who makes Games for electronic devices

What is Game Development?

Game Development is the art of making simulations of graphics on electronic devices which includes user interaction, input and output devices, level design, concepts creation and more such things like physics, mathematics and programming. It is possible to make a 2D or 3D only by a single developer or by a company of any size. Game Development is huge term which involves roles like sound designers, animation developers, mechanics developers, physics developers, game engine developers and more. All these roles comes under the category of game development.

Types of games from history to 21st century:

  1. The first generation (2D Games) - 2D Games are created with flat graphics called sprites and don't have any 3D geometry. These games were the first generation of games that early days consoles and computsers can offer. They were created using programming languages like C and C++. In those days as computers were not much powerful to render good 3D graphics and it was also hard to make games without using modern frameworks that exists today.
  2. The second generation (3D Games) - 3D Games uses three dimensional geometry which involves creation of worlds and spaces that uses the same principles of our own world as a foundation for creating their own 3D environments. For example in a 3D game when users gets closer to the objects it appears larger in size. In the early days of 3D games it was hard to create games with libraries such as OpenGL so game enginers like Unity, Unreal Engine and Godot comes into picture and offers GUI interfaces and scripting languages like C#, JavaScript, Lua and more.
  3. The third generation (AR/VR Games) - Argumented Reality and Virtual Reality seems similiar to most people but in reality the both are different from each other. In simple words AR is way to integrate information from a computer to real world objects and make them both work interactively with each others. On the other hand VR is a artifically generated simulation of real world or a totally different from real world which a user can interact with in real time as if the user is currently in the same simulated environment. These AR/VR games are the new types of games which are supported by frameworks like Unity and Unreal Engine.

Roles of responsibilities of a Game Developer:

  • Designing thier or using others assets
  • Level design
  • Concepts design
  • Sound design if necessary
  • Scripting
  • Server Design if necessary

How much time it takes to become a Game Developer?

  1. 2D Games - They are generally beginner friendly and requires 2D maths only. Beginners can start with frameworks like game maker studio and unity but before learning these frameworks one should have a good understanding of any one programming language which will take around 4 to 8 weeks.
  2. 3D Games - These games are slightly more complicated than 2D games but depends alot on how good a user is in physics and 3D maths but still it does not requires so much maths as it depends on the use case and frameworks like Unity and Unreal Enginer already do a lot of heavy lifting behind the scenes. For a beginner directly learning 3D games development without experience in 2D games will take around 12 to 30 weeks but depends on the person as well.
  3. AR/VR - These are the modern way of creating games but still not widely adopted but have great future in the gaming industry development of these are games are more complicated than 3D games. It is better to learn how to make 3D games before jumping directly into AR/VR games but its not necessary. Unity and Unreal Engine also supports the development of these games. For a beginner directly learning AR/VR games development without having an experience in 3D games will take around 12 to 30 weeks but depends on the person as well.

title: How to become a React Native or Flutter Developer?
html:
The person who creates apps for both Android and iOS.

What is Mobile App Development?

Mobile App development is the practice of creating applications for the mobile devices that do certain operations on the data and help users interact with thier phones easily. Mobile App development consisits of Native, Hybrid and Cross Platform Apps. Initially mobile apps development was only possible with the native development solutions but as time goes and business needs changes the need for Hybrid and Cross Platform apps development arises.

Difference between Native, Hybrid and Cross Platform Apps:

  1. Native - Native Apps are those applications which are created using the native SDK, programming language and tools provided by the OS. Native apps are not portable means they can only run on the OS for which they are specifically being created.
    Android supports C++, Java and Kotlin for its native apps development.
    iOS supports Objective-C and Swift for its native apps development.
  2. Hybrid - Hybrid Apps are those applications which are created using web based programming languages like HTML, CSS and JavaScript because they uses mobile's web view object and they are not good for CPU intensive work due to not being a native app.
  3. Cross Platform - Cross Platform Apps are those applications which can be created using one programming language and can support multiple OS's and they build native applications seprately for both the OS's this helps companies reduce thier development costs. ReactNative and Flutter these two tools are very famous and used heavily in the Cross Platform apps development.

Two famous mobile OS's for cross platform apps:

  • Android - It is an open source operating system based on Linux Kernel developed by Andy Rubin in September 2008 and its currently the most popular operating system of 2021. It is easily available in any smart phone these days and it has a huge apps eco system.
  • iOS - It is a mobile operating system created by Apple Inc in June 2007. It is not an open source operating system and only runs on Apple's iPhones and other iOS supported Apple devices. Due to not being open source its is the second most popular operating system in 2021.

Cross Platform Apps Development Frameworks:

  1. React Native - It is an open source mobile apps development framework created by Facebook in 2015. Since its first launch it has taken a huge share in the market of mobile apps development and now one of the most used Cross Platform Apps development framework. It supports JavaScript and TypeScript for the development of mobile apps.
  2. Flutter - Flutter is an open source UI SDK (software development kit) created by Google in 2017. It not only supports cross platform apps for mobile devices but also for desktops os as well. It is written in C, C++ and Dart. Since its release it has also taken a great spot in the cross platofrm apps development market. Dart is primiraly used to create applications using Flutter.
  3. Xamrain - It is an open source platform for building cross platform iOS, Android and Windows aplications using .NET services. It was created in 2011 and later owned by Microsoft.

Roles and Responsibilites of a React Native or Flutter Developer:

  1. Structue the layout
  2. Defining the routes for navigation
  3. Managing different states
  4. Interacting with internal and external APIs
  5. Interacting with a backend server if necessary
  6. Improving efficiency and fixing bugs in the apps

How much time it takes to become one of these developer?

  1. React Native - The prerequisite for making apps using react native is basic knowledge of either JavaScript or TypeScript. Beginners usually starts with JavaScript and learning basics of it will take around 4 to 5 weeks. Understanding the frameworks itself will take 1 to 2 weeks.
  2. Flutter - The flutter frameworks uses Dart to create apps. Dart is a very beginner friendly programming language similiar to javascript and will take the same time to get fimiliar with the syntax. After the language understanding the flutter framework itself will take around 1 to 2 weeks.

title: How to become an iOS developer?
html:
The person makes apps for iPhones, iPad, iWatch and other Apple iOS based products.

What is iOS and why its the second most used operating system after Android?

iOS stands for iPhone Operating System but now a days its not only available on iPhone but on other Apple devices like iPad, iWatch etc. It is primarily a mobile OS developed by Apple Inc in June 2007. It is written in programming languages like C, C++, Objective-C, Assembly and Swift. As iOS is not an open source free operating system it can only be available in Apple products. People must have to buy Apple devices in order to use iOS. It is one of the most premium OS as Apple devices are really high quality and expensive. Not being open source in nature other phones manufacturing companies can not release their products with iOS installed and they usually ship their devices with Android OS instead and that's the reason being Android the most popular OS and then iOS comes after taking up the second place in most popular OS.

What is iOS Apps Development?

iOS apps development is the practice of creating applications for iOS devices in the form of UIs (User Interfaces). In the early days of iOS Object-C was the only and official programming language to create iOS applications but later Apple has introduced a new programming language called Swift to meet the needs of modern and fast development and Swift is the current official programming language for creating iOS applications. Swift is very fast and easy to understand as it has less boilerplate and syntax compared to Objective-C.


Roles and Responsibilities of an iOS Developer:

  • Structuring the layout UI
  • Designing Routes for better UX
  • Interacting with server if needed
  • Interacting with various internal and external APIs
  • Writing clean code
  • Managing app efficiency and responsiveness across all targeted devices.

How much time it will take to become an iOS developer?

The time to become and iOS developer varies from person to person and the amount of time one has spent in learning about the iOS ecosystem. The first step is to learn the basics of Swift programming language which includes concepts like (statements, expressions, operators, variables, constants, functions, arrays, loops, objects, classes) and more. After getting familiar with the basics of Swift which will take around 4 to 8 weeks then one can start iOS apps development using Xcode which is an IDE (integrated development environment) created by Apple for easier the development of iOS and MacOS applications. MacOS app development also supports Swift. Learning how to design and structure a iOS application in Xcode will take around 4 to 8 weeks again because developers work with libraries most of the time and prevent re-inventing the wheel. Working with other people code and understanding it takes time.


Popular courses to learn iOS development online:

  1. iOS & Swift - The Complete iOS App Development Bootcamp - by Dr. Angela Yu
  2. SwiftUI Masterclass 2021 - iOS 15 App Development & Swift 5 - by Robert Petras

title: How to become an Android Developer?
html:
The person who creates apps for android devices

What is Android OS and Why its so popular?

Android is an Open Source operating system initially created by Andy Rubin. The first Android release was Android version 1.0 in September 2008, and then after the versions 1.5 all its versions has started comming with a code name along with its version names.
Here are few of the Android version names (Cupcake, Donut, Eclair, Froyo, Gingerbread, Honey Comb, Ice Cream Sandwich, Jelly Bean, Kitkat, Lollipop, Marshmallow, Nougat, Oreo, Pie, Android 10, Android 11).

Android OS is based on the Linux kernel and built with programming languages like (C, Assembly, Go, Java, Python and more). But Android SDK (Software Development Kit) support programming languages like C++, Java and Kotlin. In recent years Kotlin has gained the most popularity for developing Android apps using the SDK.

Android being the most famous OS because due to its open source nature all the gadgets manufacturing companies like Samsung, LG, Sony and more can easily ship thier gadgets with Android OS installed and those devices can then offer a huge ecosystem of android applications via the Google Play Store. Android portability makes Android the most famous OS because Android devices are cheaper than IOS because hardware companies don't have to pay for the lisenced software. The great Android apps ecosystem created by developers and communities around the world also plays a big role in its popularity.

What is Android Development?

Android Development is the practice of creating applications using the SDK (Software Development Kit) for Android devices (Phones, Tablets, TVs, Watches and other Smart Gadgets). Android Developers primiraly creates apps for Smart Phones. Android Developers make apps which can function offline and online.
Android apps which provides services with the use of internet interacts with a server acting as the backend service of that application. Android apps can now a days provide 3D, VR, AR experiences to user.

Programming Languages Used in Android Developmet:

  1. Java - It was the first primiraly used programming langauge for android apps development. Java has a powerful set of open source libraries which helps in the development of android apps. Now a days it is not the first choice for creating apps and its no more the official app development langauge of Android.
  2. Kotlin - It is a new programming language and Google has announced it as the official app development langauge for the Android. Kotlin has become very famous because it has a very good syntax and developers can achive the same results with less code than Java. It can also go along with Java very well.

Roles and Responsibilities of an Android Developer:

  • Structure the app layout
  • Defining routes
  • Using various kinds of internal and external APIs
  • Fetching data from the server
  • Managing state of the application

How much time it takes to become an Android Developer?

  • Programing Language - Java or Kotlin any of these programming langauges is the first requirement. After knowing the basics of the langauge one should learn OOPs concepts as it helps alot in the development of Android Apps.
    It will take around 8 to 12 weeks.
  • Android Studio - It is an IDE which helps in the development of Android Apps and its the first choice comes into mind when ever creating native android applications.

title: How to become a full-stack developer?
html:
The person who creates and contribute to the entire application

What is Full Stack Development?

Frontend + Backend together gives rise to a new term in software development is called Full Stack. As its name sounds a full stack developer has the knowledge to create both the frontend and backend of an application on its own. A frontend developer is usually referred as "polygot" or "jack of all trades master of none". Which basically means even though they know both the frontend and backend it is not entirely possible form them to master both the parts of the development cycle. Full Stack developers are usally very experienced software developers those have spent many years in the software development industry and now they are able to contribute to both sides of the development.
On the frontend side they make website/clients with languages like HTML, CSS and JavaScript and on the backend side they make web servers with languages like Python, Ruby, Java, PHP, C# and even JavaScript.

Following are the computer languages and concepts a full stack developers knows.

Frontend:

  1. HTML - (Hypertext Markup Language) defines the structure of a website. This method is used to generate and define data in web pages so that developers can understand it, but before, when there was no CSS or JavaScript, the language used to generate or define data was HTML only.
  2. CSS - Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is used to design the HTML of a web site. CSS enables developers to create beautiful designs on the web. CSS is the only language in the design ecosystem and is an essential skill for front-end developers.
  3. JavaScript - It is used to make the websites interactive so that the user can have dynamic responses as well and different experience from other users using the same website. It can also be used as an backend language.

Backend:

  1. HTTP - Hypertext Transfer Protocol is an application layer protocol that allows clients and servers to communicate by sharing data (documents/media). It is the basis of all data exchanges that occur on the web.
  2. TCP - Transmission Control Protocol is a transport protocol that helps establish a network where clients and servers can exchange data. IP is used to identify and share data in packets. The TCP connection between the client and server continues until either one of them terminates the connection.
  3. UDP - User Datagram Protocol is a transport protocol that does not require a connection between a client and a server to communicate with each other. UDP exchange data in the form of datagrams. It is very fast but unreliable because there is no guaranteed delivery of the data.
  4. Server Side Languages - There are various programming languages for backend development. Examples are Python, JavaScript, C#, PHP and Java.
  5. Database Languages - There are two types of databases SQL and NoSQL. Examples are MySQL, SQLite, MongoDB, Redis etc.

Roles and Responsibilities of a Full Stack Developer

  • Structure the website design
  • Define website routes
  • Making the website responsive
  • Fetching data from server
  • Using browser APIs
  • Setup the server
  • Defining request and response routes
  • Use of databases
  • Writing APIs documentation

How much time it takes to become a full stack developer?

  • Frontend - The frontend requires 3 computer languages HTML, CSS and JavaScript and due to this frontend takes longer than the backend.
    The frontend will takes around 2 to 3 months to get fimiliar with the basics.
  • Backend - Backend servers can be made using any programming language and it will require basic computer networks conecpts as well. It will take around 1 to 2 months. Time can be saved if one wants to learn backend from the same language of frontend the JavaScript.

title: How to become a backend developer?
html:
The person who makes web servers

What is Backend Development?

Backend development is the practice of creating a program called as server which is responsible for managing various things like state, queries and communication. Every dynamic website on the internet communicates with a server and due to this communication only the website is able to serve dynamic data to its users. Backend developers creates these servers which follows a certain pattern of communication over the internet most commonly via REST and sometimes GraphQL.

What is a REST API?

REST stands for Representational State Transfer is a architecture created by computer scientist Roy Fielding. REST APIs are Application Programming Interfaces which follows the constraints and architecture style of REST to establish a communication pattern between client and server.

What is a GraphQL API?

GraphQL API is an Application Programming Interface which only provides the data which has been specifically requested from the client. It was designed to make client and server communication faster. GraphQL helps the client to fetch data from multiple data sources from a single request.

Following are the network protocols a backend developer commonly works with.

  1. HTTP - Hypertext Transfer Protocol is an application layer protocol which enables client and server to communicate via sharing data (documents/media). It is the foundation of all the data exchanges that happens on the web.
    It works on top of TCP which is powers its to achive reliable data transfer.
  2. TCP - Transmission Control Protocol is a transport protocol which helps client and server establish a network communication through which they can exchange data. It uses IP to identify and share data in the form of packets.
    A TCP connection between client an server lives until one of them terminates the connection.
    TCP is very reiliable in data transfer as compared to UDP and that's the reason why TCP is used as the foundation of HTTP.
  3. UDP - User Datagram Protocol is a transport protocol which does not require a connection to be established between the client and server to start communicating with each other. Communication made over UDP is in the form of datagrams. It is very fast and unreliable as it does not gaurantee the delivery of the data in excat order and due to its unreliable nature it is not preferred for HTTP.

Roles and Responsibilities of a Backend Developer

  • Structure the server work flow
  • Defining request and response routes
  • Making the server efficient
  • Storing the data in harddisk or memory databases like (MySQL, MongoDB and Redis).
  • Creating APIs (REST, GraphQL)
  • Writing documentation about the API

How much time it takes to become a backend developer?

  1. How the web works - A backend developer should know the basics of how the web works.
    These 4 are the must known concepts OSI Model, TCP, UDP and HTTP. It will takes 2 to 3 days.
  2. Programming Language - A programming language is important because it helps the developer interact with the computer file system, memory, networking protocols etc. A server program is the result of various instructions given to the computer via a programming language. Commonly used programming languages for server programming are Python, JavaScript, Java, C#, PHP and more because almost every programming language supports the creating of a server. It will take 4 to 12 weeks.
  3. Database Language - The databases are categorized into two categories SQL and NoSQL. Just like programming languages these database languages acts as a scripting languages to interact with the programs called Databases. Commonly used SQL and NoSQL languages are MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, MongoDB etc. It will take 10 days to 1 week.

title: How to become a frontend developer?
html:
The person who makes websites interactive

What is Frontend Development?


A frontend developer is a person who creates GUIs from the data and present it in an understandable form to other people.
Everyone using internet wants to interact with websites to have a better internet experience and frontend developers are responsible for
prividing a better website experience to the users. However many people relates a web designer to a frontend developer but both of these jobs are
different from each other and requires different levels of skills.
A web designer have uses tools and his/her artistic imagination to build beautiful looking web designes. On the other hand a front end developer
later convert that design into an actual interactive website.
You can think of like that

Frontend developers gives life to the web designers design


A frontend developer has an expertise of these computer languages HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

Following are the computer languages a frontend developer usually works in.

  1. HTML - Hyper Text Markup Language or HTML is the bare bones of a website. It is used to structure and define the data on a web page in an understandable
    manner for the developer but in the old times when there was no CSS and JavaScript, HTML was the only language people use to interact with while creating or using a website.
    But in the modern days due to the change in needs and compition design of a website highly matters to attract the visitors and users of the website.
  2. CSS - Cascading Style Sheets or CSS holds the power to make HTML look beautiful. Talking about the design CSS is the one which helps in creating good looking designs on the internet
    CSS is a must skill of a frontend developer as its the only language in the design ecosystem and has no other similar language to design a web page.
    Even though CSS holds the power of making things beautiful on the web but due to complexity and range modern businesses operates today user interactivity is an highly important and thus CSS is unable to provide that.
  3. JavaScript - JS or JavaScript holds the power to make users interact with the Web super easily without even worrying about the internal details of how the web works.
    It sole purpose is to bring life to a web page by making it respond to user interactions either in the form of events or queries. It is an absolute skill of an frontend developer and they have to spend most of thier time
    working with JavaScript to fulfill the user interaction needs of thier company.

Roles and Responsibilities of a Frontend Developer

  • Structure the website layout
  • Defining the routes
  • Making the website responsive
  • Writing reusable code
  • Interact with the server

How much time it takes to become a frontend developer?

  1. HTML - It will take around 1 to 2 weeks.
  2. CSS - Many beginners thinks they have to master CSS before starting JavaScript but its a wrong mindset CSS is an vast ocean that's why you will always be learning it everyday as a frontend developer.
    Basics of CSS will take 1 to 3 weeks.
  3. JavaScript - Basics of JavaScript will take around 4 to 8 weeks. Like CSS same applies to JavaScript beginners should not focus to master the whole langauge in one go and then start building something using it. This approach is really bad
    JavaScript also has a never ending learning journey that's why being fimiliar with its programming concepts one should start applying those basic concepts and try building small projects this is the best way of learning any programming language.
  4. Frontend Frameworks - In the modern frontend development due to various challenges on the web many frontend frameworks are created to ease the development process.
    One should start learning these frameworks after building some basic to medium level projects with the vanilla JavaScript as then it will be easier to transition into these frameworks.
    Examples of frontend frameworks are Angular, React and Vue
    These frameworks are very powerful and used by small to large scale companies around the world.
excerpt:
The person who makes websites interactive

title: What is Web Development and How does it work?
html:
What is Web Development and how does it work?


It is the superset or parent of the frontend development and backend development. Web development means creating of such applications which runs and communicate over various protocols of OSI model on a high level.
Example of such protocols are HTTP, SSH, FTP or directly usage of lower level protocols like TCP and UDP.
These protocols enables web applications to send or recieve information over the internet network.
Example of data that can be share between these applications are Images, Videos, Documents, Audio and more.


There web development can be divided into two main parts.

  1. Client Side Development - It means the creation of an application which acts as a client to a server (host) to send and recieve data.
    Client Applications runs on very commonly used software called Web Browser which helps in the rendering and communication process of a client side application.
  2. Server Side Development - It means the creation of an application which does not runs on a browser but independently on a computer operating system.
    These applications are usually responsible for a huge spectrum of things like, managing the state of the clients, storing client's information in a database, doing expensive computations for the client etc.

In modern world client and server side development is classified as frontend and backend development. Let's have a look at both of these terms.

  1. Frontend Development - It is the practice of creating graphical user interfaces (GUIs) with the help of languages like HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
  2. Backend Development - It is the practice of creating applications which are not hidden from user and communicates with the client queries and these applications are usually responsible for handling the business logic.

title: How to implement Stack in JavaScript
html:
LIFO - (Last In First Out)

What is Stack?

Stack is a very important and useful data structure which is useful in wide variety of applications. It is a linear data structure and follows LIFO (Last In First Our) principle for various operations such as addition or removal of elements.

Implementation of Stack using JavaScript

class Stack {
  
    // Array is used to implement stack
    constructor() {
        this.items = [];
    }
  
    
    // push function
    push(element) {
        // push element into the items
        this.items.push(element);
    }
    
    // pop function
    pop() {
        // return top most element in the stack
        // and removes it from the stack
        // Underflow if stack is empty
        if (this.items.length == 0)
            return "Stack is underflow";
        return this.items.pop();
    }
    
    // peek function
    peek() {
        // return the top most element from the stack
        // but does'nt delete it.
        return this.items[this.items.length - 1];
    }

    // isEmpty function
    isEmpty() {
        // return true if stack is empty
        return this.items.length == 0;
    }
    
    // printStack function
    printStack() {
        var str = "";
        for (var i = 0; i < this.items.length; i++)
            str += this.items[i] + " ";
        return str;
    }

}

Lets understand the code line by line

Firstly, we have created a class name Stack which is the blue print for our objects that we are going to create later. Stack class contains a constructor which initializes and empty array called items for every stack class object.

Methods of Stack Class

  1. push() - Adds and element to the stack
    This method will add an element at the top of the stack.
  2. pop() - Removes an element from the stack
    As the name suggests it will remove the top most element from and the stack and return it. If the items array is empty "Stack is underflow" will be returned.
  3. peek() - Returns the top most element of stack
    Peek will not remove the top element like pop but it will only return it.
  4. isEmpty() - Returns true if the stack is empty
  5. printStack() - Returns all elements of stack
    This method is useful in viewing all the elements of a stack

title: How video calling is helping the world be connected
html:
Video Calling has changed the world in a positive way.

What is Video Calling?

Video Calling is the process of connecting individuals or group of people together watching each others face through their laptops, smartphones, tablets and smart watches over the internet.

Video Calling benefits for Teams

Organizations depends heavily on communication of the information whether it is in the form of orders, meetings, fun talks, decisions etc. No organization can function without the need to have communication.

Following are the benefits of video calling for teams

  1. In 2020 and the mid of 2021 majority of the organizations adopted remote work policy which was only possible via video calls.
  2. It helps in explaining the business with others.
  3. It helps teams to connect from any part of the world where internet is available.
  4. Modern video calling techniques helps better calls on cheaper network connections.
  5. No need to go to computer caffe.
  6. Your smartphone can turn into your mini office.
  7. Laptops, Smart phones, Computers, Smart watches all supports cross platform video calls.

Video Calling benefits for Individuals

We humans are social beings and like to stay connected with the people we know and care about. For example friends, family and pets.

Following are the benefits of video calling for individuals

  1. Everyone can stay connected with their friends family across the globe.
  2. Enjoy the live view of places their friends and family lives or travels.
  3. People can attend virtual appointment with their doctors.
  4. People can attend their officer meetings at home.
  5. People can share experiences through it.

Video Calling benefits for Schools and Universities

Teachers and their students have to communicate so often and it helps in understanding concepts and solving problems.

Following are the benefits of video calling for schools and universities

  1. It helps them to take online classes.
  2. It opens new doors to students studying from aboard.
  3. Cross country education is only possible because of video calls.
  4. Video call sessions can be recorded so that students can use them later as revisions.
  5. Adoption of technology and modern tools among students and teachers.

Video Calling benefits for Gamers and E-Sports

Online gaming requires a lot of team work and better communication is the key to better team work.

Following are the benefits of video calling for gamers and e-sports

  1. Multiplayer games performance relies heavily on better communication.
  2. Game competitions can be held globally.
  3. Gamers can create streams invite guests and entertain their viewers.

title: How to upload files on Dogefiles?
html:
Dogefiles is one of the most popular and brand new cloud storage website that provides you with excellant file uploading and downloading speed on internet. Dogefiles was created for people who want to safely store or host their files online so that they can keep their personal data or photos, memories of certian things in a vault protected.

We also provide free services for people who want to upload their files online so that people can download it for free and make some money while people download your free files.

Upload files easily on dogefiles?

  1. First you need to register on our website https://dogefiles.io
  2. Now Simply Click Sign Up and Register on our website.

After registering on the site you will see a dashboard, Simply Click New to upload your files.

Done You can also copy the link to share your files or you can simply set them to private. It your preference.

Dashboard of Dogefiles Dark Mode

Dashboard of Dogefiles Light Mode

I hope our little article helped you, Dogefiles cloud storage made easy.

title: Future is Cloud?
html:
Hello everyone, We lets talk about the cloud, shall we? Cloud are basically servers that are available over the internet.

In Simple words Cloud is availablity of a computer data over the internet for you to access. It can be computer power, storage, ram anything you want to access.

As we all know we are living in a time where in bad circumstances you have to sit at home to work or you don't want to work in human presense. Cloud is basically everywhere these days because of the easy inmternet accessbility by anyone.

Many Companies provide cloud based services for users, for eg:

  1. Google Drive and Dogefiles for storing your data online.
  2. Cloud Computer by Amazon to host your websites online.
  3. It can be anything.

Lets talk about why cloud storages are important?

Cloud Storages are really important because first of all its easy to use and access, also you don't have to storage anythong on yout hardware you can simply store it on the internet and access it securely from anywhere accros the world.

Cloud Storages are a very essential part of our internet because without cloud storages sharing files will not be a very easy task to do so.

Cloud Gaming?

I know many of you have already heard about the term cloud gaming, It is basically a high end system hosted over the internet for you to use by paying monthly subscription so that you can play high end gpu video games without having to buy your own costly PC or laptop.

Future?

Yes, for the fact  we can say that cloud is the future of the internet, because everything we do is on cloud even the website you browse the games you download everything is on the cloud. So we can say that the future of the internet is cloud Computing.

Thanks for reading the article, i hope you all learnt something from this. Have a nice day <3

title: Importance of Programming in day to day life
html:
Programming was created in 1883, Since the first great mechanical computer was created. Since that day programming is getting popular day by day from computer scientists to students.

Programming has many uses in IT sector as well as our day to day life, in this article I will talk about the importance and uses of programming langauges you can do in day to day life.

Types of Programming Languages

  1. JavaScript — 55.4%
  2. Java — 36.3%
  3. C# — 30.9%
  4. PHP — 25.9%
  5. Python — 24.9%
  6. C++ — 19.4%
  7. Node.js — 17.2% (server-side JS)
  8. C — 15.5%
  9. and more these are just the popular ones.

What are the uses of programming in IT sector?

Programming has a lot of uses in IT sector, If you don't like working for someone you can make your own program start your own company or you can join big and trusted companies like Google and make a difference.

What are the uses of programming in day to day life?

You can make many things in your day to day life with the help of programming, if you are sick someday and want to send your teacher a message in the morning that you are sick, You can simply make a automation script that will send your excuse in the morning.

There are many things you can do with programming. It is very Important that we all learn programming and contribute our products on GITHUB for free, So it can help the developers.

Thanks for taking your time to read this blog.
